summary: This document is a forwarded email chain from September 2021 regarding an Epstein/Maxwell discovery request. It references a prior communication from July 2019 concerning a 'Media Brochure' attachment discussed between FBI Victim Services personnel and an external recipient. The email shows FBI Victim Services Division personnel handling communications related to the case.

persons.name: Program Manager
persons.role: Program Manager, Victim Program Management Unit, FBI Victim Services Division
persons.context: The sender of the main email on September 13, 2021, asking if the recipient needs the media brochure attachment referenced in the communication.

persons.name: Victim Services Coordinator
persons.role: Victim Services Coordinator, Terrorism and Special Jurisdiction Unit, Victim Services Division/FBI
persons.context: The author of the original July 2019 email who attached and discussed a Media Brochure with an external recipient.

connections.description: Both are personnel within the FBI Victim Services Division, with the Program Manager forwarding a communication related to the Coordinator's prior work.

events.title: Media Brochure Discussion
events.description: A Victim Services Coordinator sent a Media Brochure attachment to an external recipient following a discussion.

events.title: Epstein/Maxwell Discovery Request Follow-up
events.description: A Program Manager in the FBI Victim Services Division forwarded a prior email chain regarding an Epstein/Maxwell discovery request, specifically inquiring about the need for a Media Brochure attachment.

keyFacts: The FBI Victim Services Division was involved in communications regarding discovery requests in the Epstein/Maxwell case as of September 2021.
A specific 'Media Brochure' attachment was discussed in July 2019 communications between FBI victim services personnel and an external party.
The email chain shows internal FBI handling and forwarding of case-related communications years after the initial events.
